decks.notes: The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence using efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria, Skyclave Apparition, and Aven Interrupter. It also includes ramp with Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to cast powerful spells like Collected Company and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben early in the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature beatdown and disruptive effects, while also having some protection with cards like Enduring Innocence and Ouroboroid. It is a well-balanced aggro deck that can quickly close out games with its strong creature base and efficient mana base.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells in order to quickly deplete their resources and win the game. It utilizes cards like Fatal Push and Duress to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also using powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodtithe Harvester to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption effects. The deck aims to utilize mana ramp cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to quickly play out powerful creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Archon of Emeria. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben provides additional disruption by taxing the opponent's spells, while Collected Company allows for additional creature deployment. The deck also includes protection and evasion elements with cards like Ouroboroid and Aven Interrupter, ultimately pushing for a fast and aggressive win condition.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as board wipes like Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to slow down the opponent and outvalue them in the late game. The inclusion of cards like Consult the Star Charts and No More Lies help provide card selection and advantage, while also leveraging the deck's strong mana base to consistently cast its spells.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early with cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while using cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Emberheart Challenger to maintain control of the board. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Questing Druid to provide additional threats and versatility in combat. Overall, the strategy is to be proactive and push for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while utilizing powerful threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to quickly finish off the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. Mutavault provides additional creature pressure, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can generate advantage over time. The mana base is built around Rakdos colors, with a mix of fast lands and shock lands for consistent casting of spells.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures quickly to pressure the opponent while utilizing powerful sideboard options like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command for additional support. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Aven Interrupter and Skyclave Apparition, along with disruptive choices such as Archon of Emeria, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and disruption. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth mana development, allowing for consistent threats to be deployed every turn.

This deck focuses on aggression and utilizing cheap spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It includes cards that boost creature power, provide card draw and removal, and enable direct damage spells. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells while maintaining tempo with card advantage. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes a variety of cards that pump up the power of creatures, such as Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent, as well as removal spells like Reckless Rage. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, using cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to chip away at their life total. Additionally, the deck includes lands that provide a mix of mana fixing and utility to ensure smooth gameplay.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and card advantage to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as board wipes like Supreme Verdict to control the game. It also includes a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, to provide additional support and synergy with certain creatures. The deck aims to stall the game out and grind opponents down with a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw until it can establish a winning position.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on equipping creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards that provide additional benefits when equipped, such as Fervent Champion and Cori-Steel Cutter. It also includes protection cards like Hardlight Containment and Shadowspear to ensure the equipped creatures can survive. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures equipped with powerful equipment to quickly defeat them.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle by utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, supported by spells such as Burst Lightning, Reckless Rage, and Monstrous Rage. The inclusion of cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Academic Dispute ensures both creature removal and card advantage, while the land base includes utility lands like Ramunap Ruins and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to further aid in the aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on playing efficient threats like Resplendent Angel and Skyclave Apparition, while also providing some ramp with Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic. Cards like Righteous Valkyrie and Bishop of Wings help to boost your creatures and provide additional value. Collected Company allows you to dig for key creatures and put them into play, while also providing card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to use a variety of control spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage through card draw and manipulation. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent by efficiently countering threats, removing permanents, and eventually overwhelming them with powerful planeswalkers and versatile spells. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an additional layer of synergy and value to the deck, providing a consistent source of support for the control strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of cards like Dovin's Veto, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Supreme Verdict. By using these cards to counter and remove threats while generating card advantage, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and establish dominance on the board. With the addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck is able to capitalize on the extra value provided by blinking permanents like The Wandering Emperor and Restless Anchorage to further control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures with powerful abilities, backed up by efficient burn spells to clear the way for aggressive attacks. The deck seeks to maintain aggression and pressure on the opponent, utilizing card draw and spell recursion to maintain a high tempo throughout the match. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's fast-paced strategy, enabling it to consistently cast its spells and creatures on curve.
